cyclone.name: IRMA
cyclone.current_location: about 65 mi NNE of Puerto Plata, Dominican Republic
cyclone.trajectory: Continuing WNW between Hispaniola and the Turks & Caicos toward the southeastern and central Bahamas, then turning toward South Florida

weather_observation.watch_coast: Jupiter Inlet southward around the Florida peninsula to Bonita Beach, including the Florida Keys, Lake Okeechobee and Florida Bay; Cuba from Matanzas eastward to Guantanamo
weather_observation.warning_coast: Dominican Republic north coast, northern Haiti, Turks & Caicos, southeastern-central-northwestern Bahamas
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern coast of Hispaniola, Turks & Caicos, Bahamas, north coast of Cuba, eventually the Florida peninsula
weather_observation.wind: No additional tropical-storm-force winds expected; Irma has moved well away to the northwest
weather_observation.rainfall: Additional 2–4 inches possible before showers taper off
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and dangerous rip currents will continue for another 12–24 h along north- and east-facing beaches
